0: Prepare and process import and export documentation according to customs regulations, laws, or procedures.
Clear goods through customs and to their destinations for clients.
Pay, or arrange for payment of, taxes and duties on shipments.
Calculate duty and tariff payments owed on shipments.
Request or compile necessary import documentation, such as customs invoices, certificates of origin, and cargo-control documents.
Classify goods according to tariff coding system.
Stay abreast of changes in import or export laws or regulations by reading current literature, attending meetings or conferences, or conferring with colleagues.
Sign documents on behalf of clients, using powers of attorney.
Advise customers on import and export restrictions, tariff systems, insurance requirements, quotas, or other customs-related matters.
Post bonds for the products being imported or assist clients in obtaining bonds.
Quote duty and tax rates on goods to be imported, based on federal tariffs and excise taxes.
Arrange for transportation, warehousing, or product distribution of imported or exported products.
Monitor or trace the location of goods.
Confer with officials in various agencies to facilitate clearance of goods through customs and quarantine.
Inform importers and exporters of steps to reduce duties and taxes.
Obtain line releases for frequent shippers of low-risk commodities, high-volume entries, or multiple-container loads.
Provide advice on transportation options, types of carriers, or shipping routes.
Contract with freight forwarders for destination services.
Apply for tariff concessions or for duty drawbacks and other refunds.
Insure cargo against loss, damage, or pilferage.
Prepare papers for shippers to appeal duty charges.
1: Analyze training needs to develop new training programs or modify and improve existing programs.
Evaluate instructor performance and the effectiveness of training programs, providing recommendations for improvement.

Plan, develop, and provide training and staff development programs, using knowledge of the effectiveness of methods such as classroom training, demonstrations, on-the-job training, meetings, conferences, and workshops.
Confer with management and conduct surveys to identify training needs based on projected production processes, changes, and other factors.
Conduct orientation sessions and arrange on-the-job training for new hires.
Train instructors and supervisors in techniques and skills for training and dealing with employees.
Develop and organize training manuals, multimedia visual aids, and other educational materials.
Prepare training budget for department or organization.
Develop testing and evaluation procedures.
Conduct or arrange for ongoing technical training and personal development classes for staff members.
Review and evaluate training and apprenticeship programs for compliance with government standards.
2: Monitor and record food temperatures to ensure food safety.
Cook foodstuffs according to menus, special dietary or nutritional restrictions, or numbers of portions to be served.
Rotate and store food supplies.
Wash pots, pans, dishes, utensils, or other cooking equipment.
Apportion and serve food to facility residents, employees, or patrons.
Clean and inspect galley equipment, kitchen appliances, and work areas to ensure cleanliness and functional operation.
Clean, cut, and cook meat, fish, or poultry.
Direct activities of one or more workers who assist in preparing and serving meals.
Train new employees.
Take inventory of supplies and equipment.
Requisition food supplies, kitchen equipment, and appliances, based on estimates of future needs.
Bake breads, rolls, or other pastries.

0: Process and analyze import shipments to ensure compliance with relevant regulations and customs laws.
Prepare and submit required documents, such as commercial invoices and certificates of origin, to the relevant authorities.
Conduct research and gather information on export controls, tariffs, and quotas to advise clients on trade compliance.
Coordinate with carriers and freight forwarders to facilitate smooth transportation of goods.
Clear shipments through customs by communicating with brokers, carriers, and government agencies as needed.
Ensure accurate classification of merchandise under Harmonized System (HS) codes and International Trade Code (ITC) guidelines.
Develop and maintain knowledge of changing trade laws, regulations, and policies affecting import/export transactions.
Prepare and submit reports to clients on shipment status, customs clearance, and any issues encountered during the process.
Advise clients on compliance requirements for hazardous materials, such as shipping lithium batteries or dangerous goods.
Verify the authenticity of goods being imported or exported to prevent counterfeit merchandise from entering the market.
Facilitate communication between importers/exporters and government agencies to resolve clearance issues promptly.
Maintain accurate records of shipments, clients, and contact information for all relevant parties.
Provide guidance on compliance with phytosanitary and sanitary regulations for imported food products and plant materials.
Monitor changes in global trade policies and update internal knowledge base accordingly.
Negotiate with carriers, freight forwarders, or other third-party logistics providers to secure optimal rates and services.
Prepare and submit claims to insurance companies on behalf of clients for losses or damages incurred during transportation.
Coordinate with regulatory agencies to resolve issues related to imports or exports of controlled goods.
Develop and implement effective internal controls to ensure compliance with trade laws, regulations, and company policies.
Analyze and respond to customer complaints regarding shipment status or customs clearance issues in a timely and professional manner.
Prepare and submit required documentation for customs brokers' license renewal or certification as required by regulatory authorities.
Provide training and support to junior staff members on trade laws, regulations, and industry best practices.
1: Develop and implement corporate training programs to enhance employees' skills and knowledge, in compliance with organizational objectives.
Design, conduct, and evaluate training sessions, workshops, and conferences to address specific business needs and employee competencies.
Assess training effectiveness by collecting data on participant engagement, learning outcomes, and job performance, to inform program improvements.
Collaborate with subject matter experts, stakeholders, and employees to identify training gaps and prioritize development initiatives.
Create engaging training content, including e-learning modules, presentations, and hands-on exercises, utilizing adult learning principles and instructional design frameworks.
Establish partnerships with vendors, suppliers, or external providers to access specialized training resources and expertise.
Facilitate coaching, mentoring, and feedback sessions with managers and employees to promote skill development and performance improvement.
Conduct needs assessments, gap analyses, and skills audits to inform training program planning and ensure alignment with organizational objectives.
Design and implement change management initiatives to support organizational transformation and cultural shifts, in conjunction with training programs.
Measure and report training metrics, including ROI analysis, return on investment, and learning return on effort (LROE), to justify budget allocations and resource allocation decisions.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of best practices, trends, and technological advancements in training and development, to continuously improve program effectiveness and relevance.
2: Prepare and cook meals according to institutional recipes and food safety guidelines.
Maintain a clean and sanitary kitchen environment, adhering to health and safety regulations.
Order and manage inventory of ingredients and supplies, ensuring timely replenishment and minimizing waste.
Plan and prepare menus for various events, such as weddings, conferences, and catering services.
Monitor food temperatures and presentation to ensure dishes meet quality and aesthetic standards.
Assist in the management of cash handling transactions and maintain accurate records of inventory and sales.
Train new kitchen staff on recipes, cooking techniques, and kitchen safety procedures.
Develop and implement meal planning strategies to optimize nutrition, reduce waste, and accommodate dietary restrictions.
Collaborate with other departments, such as maintenance and housekeeping, to ensure seamless operation of the cafeteria.
Inspect and evaluate food quality, presentation, and quantity to identify areas for improvement.
Maintain accurate records of food preparation, inventory management, and kitchen operations.
Implement and enforce food safety protocols, including proper handling, storage, and disposal of hazardous materials.
